Description: A hollow terracotta head of a black African, broken from a figure or a bust. Hair well indicated at the back as well as the front. Two-piece mould. Orange-brown Nile silt, the surface brown; some mica.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Ptolemaic, second or first century BC. Comparanda: Near: Fischer 1994: no. 476, dated about ad 150; Kaufmann 1913: fig. 107: 23, from the Fayum. Bibliog: Fischer 1994: no. 476.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3583)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
